[h1]TL:DR? See Conclusion[/h1]

[h1]NOTE:[/h1]
Also see my: 
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/miyumiayase/recommended/70/] Half Life (1) Review[/url] 
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/miyumiayase/recommended/220]Half-Life 2 Review[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/miyumiayase/recommended/130]Half-Life: Blue Shift Review[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/miyumiayase/recommended/362890?tscn=1431108183]Black Mesa Review[/url]

[h1]INTRODUCTION:[/h1]
Half-Life: Opposing Force (also known as Government Cover-up Simulator 1999 or Call of Half-Life: Black Mesa Warfare) is a first-person action shooter game that serves as the first expansion to the critically acclaimed and award-winning Half-Life by Valve. Unlike Half-Life however, this title was made by Valve alongside Gearbox Software. Interestingly, unlike Half-Life, the player will see the Black Mesa incident through the eyes of a U.S. Marine(the Military enemies in the first game).

[h1]PLOT (No Spoilers)[/h1]
The player takes the role of Commander…(I mean)…Corporal Shephard, a U.S. Marine with the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit who were sent to the Black Mesa Complex for an unknown operation. While en route inside an Osprey to the Complex, Shephard and his team are attacked by Xen air-borne units forcing the Osprey to crash knocking him out. Follow Shephard in his trek across the massive Black Mesa Complex in an attempt to escape while uncovering a government cover-up that would pitch Shephard against U.S. Black Operations Units, Xen forces, and a new alien threat called Race X.

[h1]PROS:[/h1]
+ New enemy types with unique abilities and weapons (instead of just rehashing the materials of the main game)
+ Fun and interesting new weapons such as the Displacer Cannon and Shock Roach
+ Well made action-packed story which shows players a different side of the Black Mesa Incident
+ Introduction of new game mechanics such as Rope Climbing, Secondary heavy melee attacks, Grappling hooks (Barnacle hook?), Night vision and Portal guns that send you (or your target) to another dimension (See Displacer Cannon above)
+ Possibly the first FPS game to implement a Military Squad game mechanic
+ Entertaining Tutorial with cultural references
+ Story intersects with some important Half-Life 1 events
+ Good voice acting for its time
+ Andrian Shephard is possibly a descendant of Jack (protagonist of Bioshock) due to his uncanny ability to wield a Wrench in battle against Black Ops Soldiers and Aliens.

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
- Relatively short game with me clocking around 5 hours of game time on hard mode.
- New squad mechanics is clunky (I can actually forgive this since it’s possibly the first squad mechanic on an FPS game)
- Puzzles are not that satisfying to solve
- Final chapter leading to the final boss feels rushed and underdeveloped
- Unsatisfying and easy final boss

[h1]CONCLUSION:[/h1]
GREAT EXPANSION that I HIGHLY RECOMMENDED specially for those who played the first Half-Life game and I say this because it is littered with several subtle nods from the main game.  

[h1]WORTH IT?[/h1]
MUST BUY AND MUST HAVE.  I, however, do recommend you purchase the Half-Life Anthology if you already have Half-Life 2 but if you do not have it, get Half-Life Complete.

[h1]FINAL NOTES:[/h1]
Opposing Force is a good example on how to make an expansion; it introduces new game mechanics, new enemies, new weapons and all the while delivering a new story that still being closely related to the main Half-Life plot.

---------------------------------------------------------

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861651-Miyumi%27s-Review-Corner/]Miyumi's Review Corner (MIRECO)[/url]

My personal favorite of the original of HL series, Opposing force takes the role of a military grunt sent to the Black Mesa compound to kill Dr. Freeman. As the events unfold, Opposing Force includes several new areas of the research facility, including a weapon able to warp individuals into the plains of Zen, much like a dark world, light world system, various new models for characters, new enemies, and greater bosses to fight. HL:OF also takes the amazing soundtrack from the original, keeping the game fresh with a comfortable style.

One of two major expansions to the original Half Life, I started playing this game after the completing the first one (Half Life Source), and wasn't expecting much for this one. Well I was so wrong, as this expansion is spectacular and well worth your time and money. It's puts you in the shoes of a military (one of the "bad guys" in Half Life), in the same time period as the first Half Life, during the Black Mesa incident. Lots of action, suprises, new weapons and new Xen aliens. If you have enjoyed Half Life, look no further, this is the next one you should play.

Fun expansion pack. Interesting to experience Black Mesa from another perspective. The squad idea seemed cool but dissapointed it was never really utilized in any meaningful way. Still fun to this day and definitely worth playing if you loved Half-life.

First off, wow. For a splinter game, it can hold it's own pretty well that I feel that I could safely recommend this game. The weapon choice alone pertain to a variation with half of the same weapons from the origin Half-life an other half existing only within this game. 

The title "Opposing Force" is a bit misleading in that corporal Shepard may work for the military, but his mission objective never quite reached him. The story development does a good job at providing Shepard with a reasonable excuse to not confront Freeman or have to kill any of the scientist. Similar to Blue shift there was a larger focus on the tactical part of the gameplay, yet intriguing puzzle still pop up at regular intervals.  Thankfully there are not too many cases of if-you-mess-this-up-there-is-no-going-back scenerios, but I've bumped into several mess-ups where loading to my last save was in my best interest. I recommend as you play through that you pay some attention to details around you such as a security guard going for a specail discount with a vending machine, and a scientist discovering the wonders of electricity in a way Benjamin Franklin would highly discourage. 

On another note, I appreciate the detail in adding night vision goggle instead of using a flashlight, but I still prefer the flashlight on the basis that it's easier on my eyes.  Too, you'll soon notice a mysterious set of aliens that never appeared in Half-life before. In fact, I don't think that these alien ever reappear within the Half-life series again. I could be wrong, but for now there's no that I could think of. 

Importantly, the game provided a satisfying ending. Don't believe me? Then you're welcome to see for yourself. Chances are someone did a thorough walkthrough of the game.
A great continuation to a great game. Less of a challenge than the original game but it is still great fun. I would recommend this game to any person who likes the Half Life series.

Mes amis disent de moi que je ne suis pas difficile, ce qui explique pourquoi j’ai quand même donné une avis favorable au jeu. Cependant, j’ai beaucoup de remarques.

Le jeu en lui-même est plutôt amusant à jouer. Il est plus orienté action que Half-Life et les puzzles sont beaucoup moins ennuyeux à faire. La plupart du temps on n’a pas à chercher plus de cinq minutes pour comprendre ce qu’il faut faire (c’est une qualité pour moi).

Concernant l’histoire, on incarne un des « spécialistes militaires chargés d’éliminer Gordon Freeman ». Personnellement je n’ai presque rien pigé à l’histoire, pourtant je ne suis pas difficile. De ce que j’ai compris on se retrouve bloqué à Black Mesa après que tous les militaires soient partis. Sur ce débarquent des Black Ops (facilement reconnaissables à leur combinaison latex) qui veulent tout péter et une mystérieuse race d’aliens, la race X qui enlève les humains pour les étudier ou bien veut terraformer la terre (c’est selon).

Au cours du jeu on est baladé un peu à droite à gauche dans Black Mesa sans trop savoir pourquoi. On sent que les gens de Gearbox sont de très gros fans de HL1 étant donné que leur jeu est presque un copié-coller des niveaux de HL1, dans l’ordre. On a même le droit à un passage sur Xen, juste pour la forme. Cependant les environnements sont soignés, plutôt variés, on s’amuse bien, que demande le peuple ?

Les concepteurs ont aussi fait un effort pour introduire de nouveaux éléments de jeu. Par exemple, il est possible de se suspendre à des cordes, mais c’est un élément très rarement utilisé. Il y a de nouvelles armes mais ce sont des espèces de gimmicks — en vrai on ne s’en sert que plutôt rarement, par manque de munitions. Par exemple on a un fusil de sniper avec une poignée de munitions dans tout le jeu et on ne s’en sert qu’une dizaine de fois en tout. C’est vraiment dommage ! Pareil pour le desert eagle. Quelle est l’utilité d’avoir un bon flingue si c’est pour passer son temps à se rationner parce que les munitions sont fournies au compte-goutte ? (environ 1 pack par niveau, j’ai compté)

Il y a aussi une petite partie du jeu qu’on peut faire avec des NPC militaires. C’est une très bonne idée qui change du mode « grunt solitaire qui pète les ennemis avec son pied de biche » d’HL. Le seul problème est que les NPC sont de vraies bidasses : sévèrement stupides et paresseux. On passe plus de temps à les chaperonner pour les faire aller quelque part qu’à se battre à leurs côtés.

La difficulté est plutôt relevée, ce qui est plutôt cool, hormis le boss final qui est une vaste blague. C’est encore une fois un copié coller de HL1, en beaucoup plus facile.

Pour conclure, Opposing Force est recommandé aux grands fans d’Half-Life. Quelques bonnes idées surnagent. 5.5/10.
The game is just tightly packed with a lot of great guns, and the story feels great, its probably one of half life's best expansion packs, and it was a great way to flesh out the universe even more.

This game doesn't stand on its own well.  It's severely dated and lacks any real story, and a lot of the choices for this game are poor.  (the alien gun that works as a grappling hook, but only in specific spots - it's otherwise useless, unforgiving difficulty in certain areas, uninspired design, etc.)

HAVING SAID ALL OF THAT - do yourself a favor and only play this game after recently finishing Half-Life 1.  All the experience and familiarity from HL will help this game a lot, and fills in what is otherwise a vacant story with the richness of the HL experience.  Otherwise, if you're like me (last played HL1 7+ years ago), this game is incredibly weak and leaves you wondering how there could be so many glowing reviews for such a poor game.  For me, my only previous play-through of Opposing Force was right after I finished HL1, and I loved it.  I can only assume it's because I've forgotten/lost so much of the HL1 experience that this was so uninteresting.

I thought the other Gearbox Half Life was kinda lack luster, this one was slightly better. I would've prefered if you really were supposed to kill all the scientist, like they did in the main game. Maybe I'm a sick fuck, who knows? I enjoyed the squad mechanic quite a bit, but when playing on hard (which is all I played on) they tend to die very quickly into a fight. I thought the rope physics were really shitty and I was worried about swinging on ropes like you did in bootcamp (which took me forever), but I was happy to find that there was no rope swinging to be found. The Boss was very challenging but also fair, unlike the real Half Life's final boss, but still wasn't as memorable... wait.. was he memorable?

Random Fact: If you ever play the Playstation version of Half Life (PS1 or 2, I can't remember), turn around right before entering Xen at the end of the game, you'll see an easter egg from this game (seeing how Gearbox developed the console port). 

I'd only get this game to show your love for Half Life, since Blue Shift and this are shorter than the real game, I'd reccomend getting both to quickly play through (should be plenty).

Opposing force - одно из трех дополнений Half-Life. В этом дополнении мы пишем историю Черной Мезы за капрала Адриана Шепарда - солдата спецподразделения HECU. Он,как и Фримен,становится любимцеи G-man'а. Игра очень трудная( я на нормальном режиме проходил,но было такое ощущение,что играю на высоком) и захватывающая(не для слабонервных). В игру были добавлены новые монстры,которых,в общем,не легко победить,но в этом нам помогают другие солдаты HECU. Сам Адриан связан с Гордоном Фрименом только тем,что он должен его убить,и у него была такая возможность в одну секунду,когда Гордон прыгает в портал,ведущий на Ксен. С Барни Калхуном он вообще не связан(он его даже не встречает в игре). И эта единственная игра из серии Half-Life,где у ГГ нету монтировки(за место неё есть Гаечный ключ). 
В общем,игра очень классная,сложная и интересная. Было бы круто,если бы Valve выпустили Opposing force 2,но,к сожалению,это невозможно из-за судьбы Шепарда(раскрывать не буду,т.к. думаю,что 199 рублей на этот шедевр не жалко потратить)(и всё из-за этого G-man'а,********,****,********).Даю оценку 10/10 (срать на графику,ведь главное не обложка,а ...).
P.S.: По моему мнению,эта часть намного лучше по сюжету,чем оригинальная Half-life.))))

K Opposing Force jsem se pořádně dostal až v roce 2010, po 11 letech od vydání a musím říct, že zábava je to stále i po těch letech prvotřídní. Level design se povedlo skloubit tak, aby hráč skutečně cítil, že je na dosah Gordona Freemana. Jenže G-Man si tak jako s Freemanem pohrává i se seržantem Shepardem, za kterého hrajete. Zcela úmyslně jsem šel s obtížností na easy, aby hra pěkně odsýpala a musím říct, že sem tam je i tato obtížnost docela náročná. Především Black Ops dokáží až neuvěřitelně nas*at a v duchu jsem si říkal, proč jsou ty zbraně proti nim tak neúčinné (kromě těžkého kulometu). Naštěstí taktika Quick Save + Quick Load stále funguje nejlépe. Výběr z arzenálu je snad ještě větší než u Half-Lifu a do ruky se vám dostanou od kulometů, sniperky a pistolí také kousky z dílen emzáků a není jich zrovna málo. Logické úkoly a jeden boss tuším v kombinaci s přitahováním se emzáckým jazykem ke zdi se mi zamlouvaly. Opposing Force patří mezi ty datadisky, které slupnete jako malinu a jste nasycení. Což se o Half-Life: Blue Shift bohužel říci nedá.

I Finished the game with almost no issues, only that you sometimes got stuck, mostly coming out of lifts.  But this isn't this Steam version's fault, these are typical glitches of the original expansion (and original Half Life game too).  You can mostly get out of them by shooting and changing weapons, otherwise you'll have to reload the last savepoint.

The expansion itself is brilliant!  I played Half Life for the first time only a few weeks ago (a whopping 16 years after it came out) and now count it among my favourite games of all time (along with Amnesia, Portal, FFVII, KOTOR).  It did the remarkable thing of making me enjoy a shooter, whereas normally I get bored of incessant enemy goon encounters: Bioshock, Uncharted & Last Of Us are just a few examples of highly-rated games that dulled me because of the frequent & repetitive enemy encounters.  

Most importantly I really enjoyed the actual shooting gameplay.  It's hugely moreish and perfectly balanced.  Opposing Force is arguably even better as it offers beguiling new weapons and dangerous new aliens, tho' the level design isn't as inspired as the original (and neither is the final boss).  

As for the story, it isn't essential to the main Half Life plot, but if you're interested in what happened to Black Mesa after Gordon Freeman teleported to Xen then Opposing Force is fully recommended!  The Briefcase Man is very present too, his role recalls that of the Cigarette Smoking Man from X-Files.

The length of OF is probably less than half the original game, but this is still a nice long experience, with some really tough sections.  

9/10

Game has great potential, but has aged very poorly in terms of gameplay mechanics. Combat is clunky, and it is easy to get stuck on "puzzles" due to bad controls. This might have been good back in the day, but not now.

After playing the famed Half life 1, I needed more. Needless to say, the game was on sale for a whopping two dollars. I managed to put my life savings together and purchase it. Sure enough, it was the best two dollars I'd ever spent. I personally like the role of a soldier, since you feel more like an actual killing machine rather than a scientist with a gun and some armor. The characters were interesting and the story even more. This game is armed with better weapons and enemies, and even puzzles. Though it may not compare with the legend Half life 2, it does take its place above Half life 1 with Gordon. RECOMEND THIS TO ANYONE WHO LIKES HALF LIFE AND FPS GAMES.
Пропал прицел,что делать?

Shout and grimace your way through the halls of black mesa again that smell like they have the air supply of Susan Boyles' quiff as Cpl Shephard with his last remaining marine buddies that kicks ass and takes no names because of weapons like a fish that spits green balls of doom. 
Assinged to the HECU combat unit,  Shephard must hunt down and rabbit punch that nerd with a stonk on for crowbars "Gordan Freeman" because he  ***** everything up by pushing a supermarket trolley into a laser beam and in the process of trying to escape black mesa he slaughtered over 9000 of your best marine buddies who you bunked with back in Texas. 
Kill and maim more aliens and more weedy scientsts as a fearless HECU operative and kill black ops' soldiers that try and get in on your three way with Gordan and the aliens. GET SOME!

About six hours of gameplay, with new weapons and enemies, so it adds quite a bit to the original game. The early part has lots of platform and timing puzzles, but towards end it gets more combat-driven.

It's less plot-driven than the Blue shift DLC, but has more new gameplay. There is still new voice acting in it, so it does have some production values for the plot, too. So figure out which you prefer, plot or new gameplay, or just get both the DLC in a bundle. Both are well made.

I felt this had a higher level of difficulty than Blue shift, and even the main game.

An Awesome Edition to the Half Life Series, The Military side of the Resonance Cascade is a very Fun Experience and unlike Blue Shift this game Expands on HL1 with Different Weapons, Enemies, Equipment and Environments and Levels, i highly Recommend its very Cheap Price.

Brilliant expansion for Half Life 1, showing another perspective on Black Mesa with new aliens and weaponary. Could have been longer though.
7.6/10

great game, whats with my crosshairs not being crosshairs... more like invisi-hairs

Great game in the Half-Life series. Sadly, there is a big BUT though:
Do not buy if you are playing on a Mac or Linux. There is a bug with the final boss, whereas upon beating the boss the game will not let you progress to the final sequence of the game. This issue has been known to Valve for over one year, but they don't fix it. Very sad.

There are workarounds on the web, such as typing "map of7a0" into the console, but it's still a shame that this is not getting fixed.
Tipikus Half Life! Örök kedvenc! :D

Usando a mesma mecânica e gráficos do original, Opposing Force conta a história de Adrian Shepard, um soldado que foi enviado à Black Mesa com um pelotão na ocorrência dos eventos de Half-Life. Eventualmente ele acaba se separando de seu grupo e tendo que lutar pela sobrevivência, contando com a ajuda não só de outros marines deixados para trás, como também de seguranças e cientistas que ele encontra pelo caminho. Aqui é apresentado ao jogador uma nova raça de alienígenas e complementa o que é contado no primeiro jogo. Assim, você vai encontrar novos inimigos e terá mais opções de armas, além de visitar outros setores da Black Mesa. Recomendo pra quem jogou Half-Life e tem interesse em se aprofundar nos seus acontecimentos.
Espansione fantastica di un gioco fantastico!
I think this is pretty much just as good as the original half-life. I say it's a must have for any half-life fan.
相比半条命剧情稍微少了点，最后的BOSS打的好蛋疼...

Good addon for the best First Person Shooter ever!

8/10

Всю первую серию Half-Life я проходил на консоли Sega Dreamcast. Всю, кроме Opposing Force.
После прохождения первых частей прошло уже больше 10-ти лет, но когда я все-таки решил пройти игру за десантника - я офигел. Намного больше врагов, чем в игре за ученого и за охранника, больший выбор оружия, очень интересное прохождение - я не отрывался от игры все 5 часов.
Что радует больше всего - игра не надоедает. Однозначно рекомендую!

Bueno ahora uno debe de seguir la perspectiva desde " el lado militar" es mejor la vision nocturna pero las armas al incio estan un poco "ligeras".  Al igual que  blue shift  no esta el audio en  español pero el juego vale la pena. despues mejora mejor el juego

To be honest I didn't like this game. It was just 5 hours of a massacre without anything that made Half Life special. Plot simply didn't exist but the moments when you crossed Gordon's timeline were quiet good. Unfortanetly the other parts weren't. 
I recommend Opposing Force if you enjoyed the fight in Half life more than anything, otherwise you get as bored as I was.

i reccomend it becuase it has a good story and a solid multiplayer

This is one of the very few games that actually allows you to see through the enemy eyes. A very interesting take, and it's made very well. And, with the gameplay of half life, it still has that great gameplay.

[h1] Сказ про спецназ [/h1]

[i]Как твоё имя, солдат? Капрал Шепард? Звучит, как Капрал Шило в Ж о п е![/i]

Half-Life: Opposing Force представляет собой отличный аддон к HL, который позволяет нам очутиться по другую сторону баррикад и поиграть за спецназовца Шепарда, прибывшего для устранения Фримена.

Но все, как обычно, идет не по плану, и мы забив на основное задание вынуждены спасать свою задницу от пришельцев и оперативников. Игра держит в напряжении до самого конца.

Отдельно стоит поблагодарить гейм-дизайнеров, которые постарались на славу. Удачно проработаны скриптовые сцены, много нового оружия (чего стоит только Спорометатель:)) и врагов, а также напарники, которые вместе с нами пытаются выжить в этом аду.

В общем и целом, если вам по душе HL, то HL:OF зацепит вас обязательно.

9 инструкторов Барнсов из 10.
